title: Introduction to Critical Analysis
description: Introduces methods of critical analysis through a range of literature written in English, broadly conceived, from different historical periods and cultural locations. Note: Not to be taken by students with 6 units in approved junior English.

title: Introduction to Critical Analysis
description: Introduces methods of critical analysis through a range of literature written in English, broadly conceived, from different historical periods and cultural locations. Note: Not to be taken by students with 6 units in approved junior English.

title: Introduction to Critical Analysis
description: Introduces methods of critical analysis through a range of literature written in English, broadly conceived, from different historical periods and cultural locations. Note: Not to be taken by students with 6 units in approved junior English.

title: Case Studies in Research
description: This variable content course introduces methods of literary research as an in-depth process through one or more case studies. Refer to the Class Schedule and the Department of English and Film Studies website for specific topics. This course cannot be repeated for credit. Note: Not to be taken by students with 6 units in approved junior English.

title: Indigenous Literatures
description: An introduction to Indigenous literatures in North America, from their earliest oral forms to their contemporary variations. Note: Not to be taken by students with 6 units in approved junior English. Sections reserved for students in the TYP Program include a 3 hour seminar component in addition to the 3 hour lecture component.

title: Introduction to English Studies
description: An introduction to studies in the discipline recommended for students considering a major, minor, or Honors degree in English. Students will be introduced to a variety of methodological approaches while learning about literary, cultural and media studies, with special attention to topics such as race, Indigeneity, ethnicity, gender, sexuality, and class. NOTES: Not to be taken by students with 6 units in approved junior English. Credit does not fulfill the Arts common English requirement. Restricted to students registered in the Faculty of Arts.

title: English for Engineering Students
description: This course aims to develop the student's ability to provide effective written and oral information. It will focus on instruction in fundamental writing skills, including building effective sentences and paragraphs, and on learning to communicate clearly across a range of genres and media used in academic and professional contexts, including correspondence and presentations. Students will be introduced to the principles of information gathering, analysis, and citation. Note: Restricted to students in the Faculty of Engineering only.

title: How Poems Work: Introduction to Poetry
description: An introduction to a range of poetic forms, techniques and theories. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS.

title: How Stories Work: Introduction to Narrative
description: An introduction to narrative and narrative theory through a range of fictional and non-fictional writing. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS. Note: not to be taken by students with credit in ENGL 219.

title: Critical Approaches to the English Language
description: Studies in the structure and social life of the English language. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS.

title: Reading Literature Across Time
description: An introduction to the history of literature by reading a wide range of texts across 800 years with a focus on cultural and social change. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS.

title: Introduction to Indigenous Literary Methods
description: A landscape of Indigenous literary methods addressing field and canon formations, shifts, debates, and the ethics of reading. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS.

title: Introduction to Literary and Critical Theory
description: An introduction to the breadth of theoretical perspectives for the study of English. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS.

title: Reading Gender and Sexuality
description: An introduction to dynamics of gender and sexuality in literary and other cultural texts, and to the critical concepts and methods key to their study. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS.

title: Reading Class and Ideology
description: An introduction to dynamics of class and ideology in literary and other cultural texts, and to the critical concepts and methods key to their study. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS.

title: Reading Race and Ethnicity
description: An introduction to dynamics of race and ethnicity in literary and other cultural texts, and to the critical concepts and methods key to their study. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS.

title: Reading Empire and the Postcolonial
description: An introduction to dynamics of colonization and its resistances in literary and other cultural texts, and to the critical concepts and methods key to their study. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS.

title: Introduction to Canadian Literatures
description: A survey of literatures in what is now Canada. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS.

title: Essay Writing for Education Students
description: This course, designed to increase the student's ability to write effective essays, emphasizes the study of grammar, punctuation, and sentence and paragraph structure. The study of models of prose style is integrated with frequent practice in writing. ENGL 299 is not a remedial course. Note: Restricted to students in the Faculty of Education. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS.

title: Social and Cultural History of the English Language
description: Studies in the historical development of the English Language. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS. Note: not to be taken by students with credit in former ENGL 311.

title: Topics in Genre
description: Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS. Note: variable content course which may be repeated if topics vary.

title: Topics in Literary and Critical Theories
description: Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS. Note: variable content course which may be repeated if topics vary.

title: Digital Culture
description: Studies in the theories, histories, and literary practices introduced by digital culture. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS.

title: Topics in Literature and Religion
description: Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS. Note: variable content course which may be repeated if topics vary.

title: Life Writing
description: Nonfictional writing and representation in memoir, biography, diaries, letters and digital modes of representing the self. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS.

title: Métis Literature
description: Studies of the contributions of Métis writers to the formation of their intellectual and community traditions. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS.

title: Topics in Indigenous Literature
description: Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS. Note: variable content course which may be repeated if topics vary.

title: Indigenous Poetics
description: Indigenous poetry and poetics in North America, including the study of the contemporary literary movement and its politics. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS.

title: Postcolonial Literature
description: An examination of the range of literature produced under and in the aftermath of colonialism and imperialism. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS.

title: Topics in Postcolonial Literature
description: Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS. Note: variable content course which may be repeated if topics vary.

title: African Writing in English
description: Selected works from the African context. Content and period focus may vary. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS.

title: Irish Writing in English
description: Selected works from the Irish context. Content and period focus may vary. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS.

title: South Asian Writing in English
description: Selected works from the Indian context. Content and period focus may vary. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS.

title: Middle-Eastern Writing in English
description: Selected works from the Middle-Eastern context. Content and period focus may vary. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS.

title: Medieval Literature
description: Selected works in the English language from the medieval period. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS.

title: Topics in Medieval Literature
description: Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS. Note: variable content course which may be repeated if topics vary.

title: Sixteenth-Century Literature
description: Selected works written in English. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS.

title: Topics in Early Modern Literature
description: Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS. Note: variable content course which may be repeated if topics vary.

title: Shakespeare
description: Studies in a selection of plays. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS. Note: Not to be taken by students with credit in ENGL 338.

title: Seventeenth-Century Literature
description: Selected works written in English. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS.

title: Eighteenth-Century Literature
description: Selected works written in English. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS.

title: Topics in Eighteenth-Century Literature
description: Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS. Note: variable content course which may be repeated if topics vary.

title: Romanticism
description: Selected works in English from 1789 to 1830. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS.

title: Nineteenth-Century British Literature
description: Selected works from 1830 to 1900. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS.

title: Topics in Nineteenth-Century Literature
description: Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS. Note: variable content course which may be repeated if topics vary.

title: Topics in American Studies
description: Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS. Note: variable content course which may be repeated if topics vary.

title: American Texts to 1900
description: Studies in selected American literary and cultural texts (film, media, material objects) to 1900. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS.

title: American Literature and Culture: Reading American Origins
description: Studies in issues and problems of origination in works from the American context. Content and period focus may vary. Prerequisite:  6 units of junior English, or 3 units of junior English plus WRS 101.

title: Race in American Texts
description: Studies in issues and problems of racialization in American literary and cultural texts (film, media, material objects). Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS.

title: Topics in Transnational American Texts
description: Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS. Note: variable content course which may be repeated if topics vary.

title: American Texts After 1900
description: Studies in selected American literary and cultural texts (film, media, material objects) from 1900 until the present. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS.

title: Modernist Literature
description: Studies in high, low and late modernism, and the avant-garde from 1900 to 1950. Note: not to be taken by students with credit in former ENGL 370. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS.

title: Topics in Contemporary Literature
description: Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS. Note: variable content course which may be repeated if topics vary.

title: Publishing Canadian Literatures
description: Addresses issues of production, circulation, and consumption in Canadian literary culture. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS.

title: Colonialism and Canadian Literatures
description: A consideration of literature's role in and responses to settler colonialism; material includes both pre- and post-1900 texts. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS.

title: Topics in Twentieth-Century Canadian Literary Movements
description: Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS. Note: variable content course which may be repeated if topics vary.

title: Writers, Institutions and the Canadian Literature Centre
description: Considers Indigenous, marginalized, and mainstream writings and their complicated relationship to the institutions of CanLit. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS.

title: Topics in Canadian Literatures
description: Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS. Note: variable content course which may be repeated if topics vary.

title: Canadian Literature and Culture: Canadian Drama and Performance
description: Selected works by Canadian dramatists and performance artists. Content and period focus may vary. Prerequisite:  6 units of junior English, or 3 units of junior English plus WRS 101.

title: Contemporary Canadian Literatures
description: Selected works from literatures produced after 2000. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS.

title: Writing from Here
description: Selected works from the Amiskwacîwâskahikan / Edmonton area and the prairies. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS.

title: Topics in Popular Culture
description: Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS. Note: variable content course which may be repeated if topics vary.

title: Youth Cultures
description: The study of the cultures of young people which may include literature, television, digital cultures, and other media formats. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS.

title: Children's Literature
description: Studies in print and oral texts, including picture books, historical, critical and theoretical approaches to literature for young people. Content and period focus may vary. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS.

title: Topics in Women's Writing
description: Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS. Note: variable content course which may be repeated if topics vary.

title: Queer and Trans Studies
description: Studies in the cultures, politics, forms, and theories of queer and trans life across a range of texts and formats. Content and period focus may vary. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS.

title: Topics in Literature and the Environment
description: Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS. Note: variable content course which may be repeated if topics vary.

title: Race, Capitalism and Culture
description: Studies in the cultural formations and contradictions of racial capitalism. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS.

title: Topics in Print Culture and Media Studies
description: Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS. Note: variable content course which may be repeated if topics vary .

title: Aesthetics and Politics
description: Studies in the relation between aesthetics and politics across a variety of cultural forms and contexts. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS.

title: History of the Book
description: Studies in the social and cultural history of the material text, and to the critical concepts and methods key to its study, that emphasizes the relationship between the production of books and the production of culture. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS. Note: not to be taken by students with credit in ENGL 208.

title: Histories of Reading
description: Studies in the social and cultural histories of reading, and to the critical concepts and methods key to its study, that emphasizes the relationship between reading and the production of culture. Prerequisite: 6 units of junior ENGL, or 3 units of junior ENGL and 3 units of junior WRS. Note: not to be taken by students with credit in ENGL 209.

title: Studies in Authors
description: Prerequisites: 12 units of senior ENGL with a minimum of 6 units at the 300 level. Note: variable content course which may be repeated.

title: Studies in Genres
description: Prerequisites: 12 units of senior ENGL with a minimum of 6 units at the 300 level. Note: variable content course which may be repeated.

title: Studies in Poetry
description: Prerequisites: 12 units of senior ENGL with a minimum of 6 units at the 300 level.  Note: variable content course which may be repeated.

title: Studies in Texts and Cultures
description: Prerequisites: 12 units of senior ENGL with a minimum of 6 units at the 300 level. . Note: variable content course which may be repeated.

title: Studies in Literary Periods and Cultural Movements
description: Prerequisites: 12 units of senior ENGL with a minimum of 6 units at the 300 level.  Note: variable content course which may be repeated.

title: Studies in the History of Reading
description: Prerequisites: 12 units of senior ENGL with a minimum of 6 units at the 300 level.  Note: variable content course which may be repeated.

title: Studies in Literary and Cultural Histories
description: Prerequisites: 12 units of senior ENGL with a minimum of 6 units at the 300 level.  Note: variable content course which may be repeated.

title: Studies in Theory
description: Prerequisites: 12 units of senior ENGL with a minimum of 6 units at the 300 level.  Note: variable content course which may be repeated.

title: Studies in Gender and Sexualities
description: Prerequisites: 12 units of senior ENGL with a minimum of 6 units at the 300 level.  Note: variable content course which may be repeated.

title: Studies in Race and Ethnicity
description: Prerequisites: 12 units of senior ENGL with a minimum of 6 units at the 300 level.  Note: variable content course which may be repeated.

title: Studies in Empire and the Postcolonial
description: Prerequisites: 12 units of senior ENGL with a minimum of 6 units at the 300 level. Note: variable content course which may be repeated.

title: Studies in Drama and Performance
description: Prerequisites: 6 units of junior English or 3 units of junior English plus WRS 101; and 12 units of senior-level English, 6 units of which must be at the 300 level. Note: variable content course which may be repeated.

title: Studies in Popular Culture
description: Prerequisites: 12 units of senior ENGL with a minimum of 6 units at the 300 level.  Note: variable content course which may be repeated.

title: Studies in Literature and Film
description: Prerequisites: 12 units of senior ENGL with a minimum of 6 units at the 300 level.  Note: variable content course which may be repeated.

title: Topics in Media Studies
description: Prerequisites: 12 units of senior ENGL with a minimum of 6 units at the 300 level.  Note: variable content course which may be repeated.

title: Studies in Children's Literature
description: Prerequisites: 12 units of senior ENGL with a minimum of 6 units at the 300 level.  Note: variable content course which may be repeated.

title: Honors Essay
description: Required of all Honors students. Students will initiate discussion of their essays with the Advisor in the preceding term. In their final year, students will be required to participate in a peer workshop and consult with a faculty member on their essay.

title: Directed Reading in Fourth-Year Honors English
description: Note: Students may take this directed-reading course no more than once during their program.
